title: Is there an appeal site here?

replies.body:
To appeal an infraction, you have to email support.
support@avicus.net
replies.body_tagged:
To appeal an infraction, you have to email support.
support@avicus.net

replies.body: Wouldn't it be better to just have a section for appealing?
replies.body_tagged: Wouldn't it be better to just have a section for appealing?

replies.body: yes
replies.body_tagged: yes

reply_to.body: Wouldn't it be better to just have a section for appealing?
reply_to.body_tagged: Wouldn't it be better to just have a section for appealing?

replies.body: Well, it depends. Do you mean as in locating the place to appeal or much quicker to get unbanned/your appeal read by staff?
replies.body_tagged: Well, it depends. Do you mean as in locating the place to appeal or much quicker to get unbanned/your appeal read by staff?

reply_to.body: Wouldn't it be better to just have a section for appealing?
reply_to.body_tagged: Wouldn't it be better to just have a section for appealing?

replies.body: I do feel like there should be an appeal tab on the forums.  Just like Staff Applications and Player Reports, only staff can read the threads ( obviously you will be able to read only what you post ).  This will help those who don't have an email or can't access it.
replies.body_tagged: I do feel like there should be an appeal tab on the forums.  Just like Staff Applications and Player Reports, only staff can read the threads ( obviously you will be able to read only what you post ).  This will help those who don't have an email or can't access it.

replies.body: From my knowledge there'll be a separate section on the website for appeals, coming in the update.
replies.body_tagged: From my knowledge there'll be a separate section on the website for appeals, coming in the update.

replies.body: If there was a page on the forums and you didn't register before your ban then.............
replies.body_tagged: If there was a page on the forums and you didn't register before your ban then.............

replies.body_tagged: Lol, good point. That would be bad.

replies.body: Which is why people suggest we have both, a forums page and an email, or you can register for the forums without being ingame

replies.body:
There isn't any section to appeal your punishments as stated above.
The only way to appeal a ban or an infraction is by e-mailing support@avicus.net.

Thanks and have a good day ^-^
replies.body_tagged:
There isn't any section to appeal your punishments as stated above.
The only way to appeal a ban or an infraction is by e-mailing support@avicus.net.

Thanks and have a good day ^-^

replies.body:
Well if they did register, great. They could use the tab on the forums.

However if they didn't, they'll have no option but to email support@avicus.net, if they wish to appeal. 

I guess if that was implemented, there'd be some way to appeal, whether that be on the forums or through the email.
replies.body_tagged:
Well if they did register, great. They could use the tab on the forums.

However if they didn't, they'll have no option but to email support@avicus.net, if they wish to appeal. 

I guess if that was implemented, there'd be some way to appeal, whether that be on the forums or through the email.

reply_to.body: If there was a page on the forums and you didn't register before your ban then.............
reply_to.body_tagged: If there was a page on the forums and you didn't register before your ban then.............

replies.body:
So just like the staff applications, but Sr. Staff can see them all, not mods, however regular players- if sent one in- can only see theirs and the responses on it, just like the staff applications, with [Denied] or [Accepted] then a message stating why and what to next.

Would you prefer that to emailing support@avicus.net?
replies.body_tagged:
So just like the staff applications, but Sr. Staff can see them all, not mods, however regular players- if sent one in- can only see theirs and the responses on it, just like the staff applications, with [Denied] or [Accepted] then a message stating why and what to next.

Would you prefer that to emailing support@avicus.net?

replies.body: I would say have a completely separate page on the website, something like avicus.net/appeal, not related to the forums. That way if users want to appeal but didn't register for the forums, they would still be able to do it. It would probably show up under the "admin" section of the website for senior staff, and moderators won't be able to view them. They'd also have to enter their email address and that's how the response, as well as any future communication, would be delivered. Just a thought.
replies.body_tagged: I would say have a completely separate page on the website, something like avicus.net/appeal, not related to the forums. That way if users want to appeal but didn't register for the forums, they would still be able to do it. It would probably show up under the "admin" section of the website for senior staff, and moderators won't be able to view them. They'd also have to enter their email address and that's how the response, as well as any future communication, would be delivered. Just a thought.

replies.body: Ok, I know this is completely off topic, but I really would like to know. I created my own post, but I didnt have a option to add a message/comment with it. It has the title, but it wont let me add a message. Could someone help? Thanks :)
